intro: Scurrula chrysanthoides, commonly known as the golden scurrula, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has a compact, bushy growth habit with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively rare in cultivation.
